text: Hi all i have a question regarding the dagger-mvp-update branch.. I am trying to make a sample for rxjava+retrofit +dagger using the beautiful sample that you guys have provided. I saw for each fragment we have a fragment component and a module for that specific view..I really liked this idea but I was just concerned will this be same when i have 1 activity holding 10 fragment or more.. Also I wanted to ask is there any specific reason for starting the presenter cycle from on resume?
html: Hi all i have a question regarding the dagger-mvp-update branch.. I am trying to make a sample for rxjava+retrofit +dagger using the beautiful sample that you guys have provided. I saw for each fragment we have a fragment component and a module for that specific view..I really liked this idea but I was just concerned will this be same when i have 1 activity holding 10 fragment or more.. Also I wanted to ask is there any specific reason for starting the presenter cycle from on resume?

text:
Hey guys ‚Äì great work on the MVP samples. It's always a great reference to implementing this separation of concerns. 

I have a question about the View contract. If the Presenter requires information such as the value of a `EditText` from the View. Should that be exposed in the `View` contract? (e.g. View#getEmailAddress)?
html:
Hey guys ‚Äì great work on the MVP samples. It's always a great reference to implementing this separation of concerns.

I have a question about the View contract. If the Presenter requires information such as the value of a EditText from the View. Should that be exposed in the View contract? (e.g. View#getEmailAddress)?

text: @AeroEchelon  I think  view should set a listener to `EditView`, and when `EditView`'s content changed, send this content to Presenter(eg. `view.onEditContentChanged(str)`)
html: @AeroEchelon I think view should set a listener to EditView, and when EditView's content changed, send this content to Presenter(eg. view.onEditContentChanged(str))

text: @Juude What if the presenter needs this state data when the content isn't changing? Would it be appropriate to cache this data on demand?
html: @Juude What if the presenter needs this state data when the content isn't changing? Would it be appropriate to cache this data on demand?

text: I think Room is broken
html: I think Room is broken

text: The auto-generated DAO implementation is trying to return a variable `_return` that is never defined.
html: The auto-generated DAO implementation is trying to return a variable _return that is never defined.

Simple dao method

  @Query("SELECT * FROM Channels")
  List<Channel> getChannels();

Auto-generated implementation

  @Override
  public List<Channel> getChannels() {
    final String _sql = "SELECT * FROM Channels";
    final RoomSQLiteQuery _statement = RoomSQLiteQuery.acquire(_sql, 0);
    final Cursor _cursor = __db.query(_statement);
    try {
      return _result;
    } finally {
      _cursor.close();
      _statement.release();
    }
  }

text: _result is never defined and therefor causes an error when trying to build the app
html: _result is never defined and therefor causes an error when trying to build the app

text: Hey everyone! I'm using travis ci and with the latest version of proguard the log length is just so long the travis ci job terminates.

text: with the message "The job exceeded the maximum log length, and has been terminated."
html: with the message "The job exceeded the maximum log length, and has been terminated."

text: Anyone else face this? I searched but couldn't find a way to reduce proguards verbosity
html: Anyone else face this? I searched but couldn't find a way to reduce proguards verbosity

text: @shalzz Sounds like a build-timeout. How long does your build take before failing?  Check this out: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/customizing-the-build#Build-Timeouts
html: @shalzz Sounds like a build-timeout. How long does your build take before failing? Check this out: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/customizing-the-build#Build-Timeouts

text: @dimitrisCBR Its not a build timeout rather a log length limit:
html: @dimitrisCBR Its not a build timeout rather a log length limit:

text: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/common-build-problems/#log-length-exceeded
html: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/common-build-problems/#log-length-exceeded

text: The proguard just spams the build output with class info which I don't remember it doing before only recently
html: The proguard just spams the build output with class info which I don't remember it doing before only recently

text: Here is my build log: https://api.travis-ci.com/v3/job/152020741/log.txt?log.token=XjZwCfmUcEwYxA4aGCXUTw
html: Here is my build log: https://api.travis-ci.com/v3/job/152020741/log.txt?log.token=XjZwCfmUcEwYxA4aGCXUTw

text: Mainly with ProGuard, version 6.0.3
html: Mainly with ProGuard, version 6.0.3

text: @dimitrisCBR Is there a way I can tweak the proguards verbosity?
html: @dimitrisCBR Is there a way I can tweak the proguards verbosity?

text: @shalzz The only thing I can think of, is removing " -verbose‚Äù and ‚Äú-printconfiguration" option from your proguard-rules. Take a look here: https://www.guardsquare.com/en/products/proguard/manual/usage#generaloptions
html: @shalzz The only thing I can think of, is removing " -verbose‚Äù and ‚Äú-printconfiguration" option from your proguard-rules. Take a look here: https://www.guardsquare.com/en/products/proguard/manual/usage#generaloptions

text: @dimitrisCBR Ah! yes, thanks. This is exactly what I was looking for.  Somehow I just kept thinking there would be an environment variable that I'm missing ...
html: @dimitrisCBR Ah! yes, thanks. This is exactly what I was looking for. Somehow I just kept thinking there would be an environment variable that I'm missing ...
